item.title: 大多数银行预计黄金牛市将持续到 2025 年
item.description: 由于交易所交易基金（ETF）的大量资金流入复苏，以及包括美国联邦储备委员会在内的全球主要央行将进一步降息的预期，各大银行预计黄金价格的破纪录涨势将延续到2025年。【原文：Major banks expect gold to extend its record-breaking price rally into 2025 because of a revival in large inflows to exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and expectations of additional interest rate cuts from prominent central banks around the world, including the U.S. Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司开始在美国进行第二阶段裁员，内部备忘录如是说
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，随着媒体巨头努力提高盈利能力，派拉蒙全球公司已开始在美国实施第二阶段的裁员计划。【原文：Paramount Global has begun the second phase of its planned layoffs in the United States as the media giant pushes toward increasing profitability, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: FAA 称波音安全文化改革可能需要数年时间
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局局长周二告诉美国众议院小组委员会，波音公司的安全文化改进工作可能需要三到五年才能完成。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration told a U.S. House subcommittee Tuesday that safety culture improvements at Boeing may take three to five years to complete.】

item.title: 穆迪称美国下届政府的财政状况将趋于恶化
item.description: 据评级机构穆迪（Moody's）称，由于政治两极分化，任何新总统政府都很难就减轻国债负担所需的措施进行谈判，美国的财政健康状况预计将进一步恶化。【原文：U.S. fiscal health is expected to deteriorate further as political polarization makes it hard for any new presidential administration to negotiate steps needed to reduce the national debt burden, according to ratings agency Moody's.】

item.title: 受劳动力市场担忧影响，美国 9 月消费者信心下滑
item.description: 由于对劳动力市场健康状况的担忧日益加剧，9月份美国消费者信心意外下降。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in September amid mounting worries over the health of the labor market.】

item.title: Brightmine 称，英国雇主的加薪幅度是 2022 年 6 月以来最低的
item.description: 人力资源数据公司Brightmine周二公布的数据显示，在截至8月底的三个月里，英国雇主给员工的加薪幅度创下了自2022年6月以来的新低，加薪幅度中位数为4%。【原文：British employers gave staff the joint-lowest pay rises since June 2022 in the three months to the end of August, offering a median raise of 4%, figures from human resources data company Brightmine showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Visa 因美国司法部指控借记卡垄断的诉讼报告而下跌
item.description: 有报道称，美国司法部计划对这家全球最大的支付处理商提起诉讼，指控其非法垄断美国借记卡市场，Visa 公司股价周二下跌 3%。【原文：Visa shares fell 3% on Tuesday after a report said the U.S. Department of Justice plans to file a lawsuit against the world's largest payment processor, alleging it illegally monopolized the country's debit-card market.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，随着保留汇丰银行员工的承诺接近尾声，加拿大皇家银行的银行家们担心裁员
item.description: 据六位熟悉情况的消息人士透露，加拿大皇家银行的一些员工是在汇丰银行加拿大分行被收购后加入该行的，他们担心在本月为期六个月的担保期到期后会失去工作。【原文：Some Royal Bank of Canada employees who joined as part of an HSBC Canada acquisition are worried about losing their jobs when a six-month guarantee expires this month, according to six sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 西方 ETF 投资者准备为黄金创纪录的涨势火上浇油
item.description: 分析师说，未来几个月黄金交易所交易基金的资金流入量，特别是来自西方投资者的资金流入量将增加，这将为已经创下历史新高的金银价格增添更多的利好刺激。【原文：Inflows into gold exchange-traded funds, particularly from Western investors, are set to rise in coming months, adding yet more positive stimulus for already record high bullion prices, analysts said.】

item.title: Vista Outdoor 推迟股东大会，再次就南玻交易进行表决
item.description: Vista Outdoor 再次推迟召开特别股东大会，就捷克斯洛伐克集团（CSG）21.5 亿美元收购该公司弹药部门及其户外部门股份的报价进行投票。【原文：Vista Outdoor has again delayed a special shareholder meeting to vote on Czechoslovak Group's (CSG) $2.15 billion offer for the firm's ammunition unit and a stake in its outdoor division.】

item.title: 汽车之家因成本上升季度利润不及预期；股价下跌
item.description: 汽车零部件零售商 AutoZone 周二公布的第四季度利润低于预期，受到通胀挑战的影响，其股价在早盘交易中下跌近 5%。【原文：Auto parts retailer AutoZone reported a lower-than-expected fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by inflationary challenges, sending its shares down almost 5% in early trade.】

item.title: 英国竞争监管机构将与谷歌合作解决有关 Chrome 浏览器 cookies 的问题
item.description: 英国竞争监督机构周二表示，将与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司合作解决竞争问题，因为该机构发现，谷歌对 Chrome 浏览器上的第三方 cookie 所采取的修订方法仍会引发广告市场的担忧。【原文：UK's Competition watchdog said on Tuesday it would work with Alphabet-owned Google to address competition concerns after it found the company's revised approach towards third-party cookies on Chrome still raised concerns in the advertising market.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会对 11 家违反记录保存规定的公司处以超过 880 万美元的罚款
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周二宣布，11 家经纪自营商和投资顾问已同意支付超过 8800 万美元的罚款，以解决他们未能妥善保存电子通信记录的指控，这是美国监管机构在一系列此类执法行动中的最新一次。【原文：Eleven broker-dealers and investment advisers have agreed to pay fines of more than $88 million to resolve allegations they failed to keep proper records of electronic communications, U.S. regulators' latest in a series of such enforcement actions, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission announced Tuesday.】

item.title: 马斯克说他的公司正寻求在阿根廷投资
item.description: 特斯拉和 SpaceX 公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周二在 X 上发帖说，他的公司正在寻找投资阿根廷和支持这个南美国家的途径。【原文：Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, said in an X post on Tuesday that his companies are looking for ways to invest in Argentina and support the South American nation.】

item.title: Vista、Blackstone 将以 84 亿美元收购 Smartsheet，这是今年最大的私有化交易之一
item.description: 收购公司 Vista Equity Partners 和 Blackstone 周二表示，将以 84 亿美元收购协作软件制造商 Smartsheet，这是今年最大的私有化交易之一。【原文：Buyout firms Vista Equity Partners and Blackstone will purchase collaboration-software maker Smartsheet for $8.4 bln in one of the largest take-private deals this year, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 飓风威胁促使美国海湾沿岸能源设施缩减运营规模
item.description: 预计本周将有一场大飓风席卷近海产油区，在美国墨西哥湾沿岸运营的能源公司已开始缩减运营规模并撤离生产地点。【原文：Energy companies operating in the U.S. Gulf Coast have started to scale back operations and evacuate production locations in anticipation of the major hurricane this week, which is forecasted to sweep through offshore oil-producing areas.】

item.title: Trafigura 任命 Richard Holtum 为新任首席执行官
item.description: 理查德-霍尔特姆（Richard Holtum）周二表示，他将从明年 1 月 1 日起接任全球贸易公司 Trafigura 的首席执行官一职。【原文：Richard Holtum will take over as Chief Executive of global trading house Trafigura from Jan. 1 next year, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜登的汽车技术禁令是打击中国电动汽车的有力新武器
item.description: 拜登政府提议禁止中国的车联网技术，这可能会成为其抵御中国廉价电动汽车冲击的最有力武器。【原文：The Biden administration's proposed ban on Chinese connected-car technology could prove its strongest weapon yet to fend off an onslaught of cheap Chinese electric vehicles that has upended the global auto industry.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼通胀风险持续存在，应更谨慎地削减利率
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周二表示，衡量通胀的关键指标仍然 "令人不安地高于 "美联储2%的目标，因此在美联储继续降息时需要保持谨慎。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said on Tuesday key measures of inflation remain "uncomfortably above" the Fed's 2% target, warranting caution as the Fed proceeds with cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国 7 月份月度房价上涨
item.description: 7 月份，美国独户住宅价格略有上涨，但在供应量增加的情况下，整体趋势正在放缓。【原文：U.S. single-family home prices edged up in July, but the overall trend is slowing amid improving supply, which together with easing mortgage rates could make buying a house more affordable.】

item.title: 墨西哥年度通胀率在利率决议前低于预期
item.description: 周三的官方数据显示，墨西哥 9 月上半月的年度通胀放缓幅度超过预期，这为该国央行在本周晚些时候的会议上再次降息铺平了道路。【原文：Mexico's annual inflation slowed more than expected in the first half of September, official data showed on Wednesday, paving the way for the country's central bank to deliver another interest rate cut at a meeting later this week.】

item.title: 对冲基金流动 美国银行称，大型对冲基金占行业份额创 8 年新高
item.description: 路透社周二看到的一份美国银行报告称，由于多策略公司占据了对冲基金业务的绝大部分份额，最大的参与者目前约占对冲基金行业的四分之三。【原文：The largest players now make up about three-quarters of the hedge fund industry, as the likes of multi-strategy firms have taken up the lion's share of the business, said a Bank of America report seen by Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势加剧，航空公司暂停航班
item.description: 对中东地区更广泛冲突的担忧促使国际航空公司暂停飞往该地区的航班或避开受影响的空域。【原文：Concerns over a wider conflict in the Middle East have prompted international airlines to suspend flights to the region or to avoid affected air space.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 高管为导致全球 IT 故障的错误更新道歉
item.description: 周二，网络安全公司 CrowdStrike 的一位高管将在美国众议院小组委员会上就该公司的错误软件更新导致 7 月份全球 IT 故障一事道歉。【原文：A senior executive at cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike will apologize at an appearance before a U.S. House of Representatives subcommittee on Tuesday for the company's faulty software update that caused a global IT outage in July.】

item.title: 瑞安航空表示，波音公司预计罢工结束后的 2-3 周内将出现混乱
item.description: 瑞安航空集团首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）周二表示，波音公司已告知主要客户瑞安航空，目前的罢工结束后，生产可能会中断两到三周。【原文：Boeing has told major customer Ryanair that production is likely to be disrupted for two to three weeks after the end of the current strike, Ryanair Group Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高通公司对英特尔的潜在竞购使其产品成为焦点
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm）已与一度占据主导地位的芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel）进行了潜在的收购接触，这让人们开始关注这些芯片公司所能提供的产品组合。【原文：Qualcomm has approached the once-dominant chipmaker Intel for a potential buyout, turning the spotlight on the portfolio of products these chip companies have to offer.】

item.title: 亚马逊等公司将购买 1.8 亿美元的同名热带雨林碳信用额度
item.description: 亚马逊和其他公司已同意购买碳抵消信用额度，以支持保护其位于巴西帕拉州的同名雨林，交易价值约为 1.8 亿美元。【原文：Amazon and other companies have agreed to buy carbon offset credits that will support the conservation of its namesake rainforest in the Brazilian state of Para, in a deal valued at around $180 million.】

item.title: 谷歌与大众合作开发智能手机人工智能助手
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌正在一款智能手机应用程序中为大众汽车司机提供人工智能助手的关键功能，这也是谷歌通过提供工具构建企业人工智能应用程序来赢得业务的战略之一。【原文：Alphabet’s Google is providing key capabilities for an artificial intelligence assistant for Volkswagen drivers in a smartphone app, part of Google's strategy to win business by offering tools to build enterprise AI applications.】

item.title: FrontView 房地产投资信托基金寻求在美国首次公开募股中最多筹资 2.77 亿美元
item.description: FrontView 房地产投资信托基金（FrontView REIT）周二表示，其在美国首次公开募股的目标是筹集高达 2.772 亿美元的资金。【原文：FrontView REIT is aiming to raise as much as $277.2 million in its initial public offering in the United States, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，德国主要研究机构将 2024 年 GDP 预测值下调至-0.1%。
item.description: 熟悉秋季联合经济预测数据的人士周二告诉路透社，德国主要经济机构下调了对2024年的预测，目前认为欧洲最大的经济体将萎缩0.1%。【原文：Germany's leading economic institutes have downgraded their forecast for 2024 and now see Europe's largest economy shrinking by 0.1%, people familiar with the figures from the autumn joint economic forecast told Reuters on Tuesday.】
